author: Ren Venkatesh
title: Officials issue urgent warning as rising waters creep toward historic establishment: 'The clock is ticking' - NewsBreak
text: As its name suggests, the Mystic Seaport Museum in Connecticut has the sea ‚Äî or, rather, the Mystic River ‚Äî right at its door. While the relationship between the museum and the river has been mostly harmonious, rising water levels are now prompting significant protective changes. Flooding at the museum site has been more frequent than ever. Historically, it might happen a few times a year. Now, flooding is a monthly or weekly occurrence, according to April reporting from the New York Times. First opening to the public in the 1930s , the museum was built on the Atlantic Ocean at the low-lying site of what once was a shipyard. Constructed on the water, it was not designed to withstand today's rising seas. At the moment, most of the museum's campus is considered a critical flood zone by the Federal Emergency Management Agency. Even the highest points are only 14 feet above sea level, per the New York Times, making floods an inevitability. "Flooding often submerges walkways throughout the campus," the paper noted , "preventing visitors from accessing buildings and experiences." As noted by the Times, researchers expect sea levels in the area to rise 20 inches by 2050. "It might not be 2050," Chad Frost told the publication, "but this isn't a question of 'if,' but rather 'when.'" The architectural expert has been collaborating with the museum for years, focusing on flood resilience since 2020. Rising sea levels primarily stem from human-caused pollution, which traps heat in our atmosphere and can cause Arctic ice melting and water to expand . In the context of the Mystic River shoreline, the higher water levels can supercharge flooding events, making them more frequent and more destructive. As temperatures increase worldwide, we can expect more intense climate shocks , including not only floods but also hurricanes and fires . Museums beyond Connecticut are making preparations to survive wildfires and extreme floods too. At the Louvre in Paris, France, artworks not on display can be stored off-site at a higher elevation, according to KRTV. Do you think your house could withstand a hurricane? No way Maybe a weak one I'm not sure It definitely could Click your choice to see results and speak your mind. "This is a slow building crescendo that gets worse the longer we wait," Frost continued , referring to the peril at Mystic Seaport's doorstep. "The clock is ticking," he added. The New York Times reported that, for the past five years, the museum has been implementing new methods for protecting its historical artifacts, including coastal barrier fortification and plans for building elevation. Specialists are also relocating some of the buildings. However, some operations are tied to the waterfront ‚Äî like the historic watercrafts on display ‚Äî and if coastal levels continue to rise, those materials could be lost or damaged. To protect the vulnerable Mystic River coast and so many others, we need to address the proliferation of heat-trapping pollution that exacerbates sea level rise and flooding events. Some steps you can take include lowering the amount of energy you consume that's fueled by burning dirty energy sources like oil, coal, and gas. Coordinating with your community can also maximize your impact. More actions to take at the community level include those similar to the efforts that Frost has helped the museum to pursue, like flood-risk assessment. Advocating for infrastructural plans and local investments to help make your neighborhood safer can reduce the costs ‚Äî financial and otherwise ‚Äî of flood recovery efforts down the line. Join our free newsletter for good news and useful tips , and don't miss this cool list of easy ways to help yourself while helping the planet. Officials issue urgent warning as rising waters creep toward historic establishment: 'The clock is ticking' first appeared on The Cool Down .

author: News Staff
title: George Stroumboulopoulos among 78 named to Order of Canada
text:
George Stroumboulopoulos among 78 named to Order of Canada
 6:00 am.
Last Updated December 28, 2023 11:11 am.
When George Stroumboulopoulos thinks back on his TV career, it‚Äôs his time hosting The NewMusic in the early 2000s that resonates most.
Many Canadians remember how the gregarious host introduced them to bands and musicians on the MuchMusic program, and those years are part of the reason he is now being appointed to the Order of Canada.
‚ÄúIt was this golden era of television that I don‚Äôt think could ever be created again,‚Äù he told The Canadian Press in an interview.
Stroumboulopoulos went on to host his own show on CBC for a decade, followed by a stint on Hockey Night in Canada from 2014 to 2016.
He has interviewed everyone from Oprah Winfrey to Hilary Clinton to Snoop Dogg ‚Äî but he said he never changed along the way.
‚ÄúWith very rare exceptions, I have been 100 per cent myself the whole way,‚Äù he said.
Stroumboulopoulos is one of 78 Canadians being awarded one of the country‚Äôs highest honours.
The list of new officers of the Order of Canada provided by the office of the Governor General includes Willie Adams, the first Inuit senator in Canada, guitar-maker Linda Manzer, editorial cartoonist Michael de Adder and pollster Nik Nanos.
Being promoted within the order are former MP and senator Serge Joyal, former MP, Cree chief and lawyer Wilton Littlechild and Dr. Ronald Stewart, who is recognized for his contributions to emergency medicine.
When Susanne Craig found out she was receiving the honour, the journalist was in the middle of a Zoom call with editors, finishing up a story on independent presidential candidate Robert F. Kennedy Jr.
‚ÄúI couldn‚Äôt believe it,‚Äù she recalled in an interview. ‚ÄúAnd then I had to get right back on the call and close the story.‚Äù
Craig‚Äôs journalism in recent years has been as high-profile as it gets, reporting on former U.S. president Donald Trump‚Äôs taxes for the New York Times.
It‚Äôs investigative work that earned her a Pulitzer Prize in 2019, but it also came with challenges including death threats, and knowing that her work would be politicized.
‚ÄúI think you just have to stand your ground,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúI always think, to me, it is about journalism, and I think you have to sort of feel at the end of the day that what you‚Äôre doing, it is about the reporting.‚Äù
Also receiving the honour is Francine Lemire, a doctor who represented Canada in the Paralympics in the ‚Äô80s.
‚ÄúIn a way, it was a love story,‚Äù she said, describing her journey to the games.
Lemire is an above-the-knee amputee. Her now-husband ‚Äúis a very good cross-country skier, and he is in fact the one who has been able to think through adjustments that would be required for me to be able to ski.‚Äù
In the 1984 games, she came in fourth in cross-country skiing. That‚Äôs the worst placing, she said ‚Äî ‚Äúyou just missed out.‚Äù
‚ÄúOne needs to learn what there‚Äôs to learn from that, and try and turn the page and get ready for the next race. And it‚Äôs never very easy,‚Äù Lemire said, adding it was an experience that taught her the importance of planning and resilience.
Four years later, she won two gold medals at the 1988 Paralypmic Winter Games in Austria.
Lemire went on to practise as a family doctor in Corner Brook, N.L., for almost 25 years. And in 2022, she retired after 10 years as the president and CEO of the College of Family Physicians of Canada.
‚ÄúThis recognition is also a validation for me of a lifetime commitment to family medicine both as a clinician, as well as organizationally,‚Äù she said.
Family doctors look after people from birth to death, and Lemire called it ‚Äúan incredible privilege to be able to enter people‚Äôs lives for the little things and big things in their life, and make a contribution, even in a small way, to ‚Ä¶ a life worth living.‚Äù
In 2020, Flavio Volpe also found himself ‚Äî improbably enough, as president of the Automotive Parts Manufacturers‚Äô Association ‚Äî playing a part in the health care system.
Volpe‚Äôs job has included initiatives like Project Arrow, the first Canadian-made electric vehicle, and helping renegotiate Canada‚Äôs trade agreement with the United States and Mexico.
When the COVID-19 pandemic first hit in March 2020, there was ‚Äúa dangerous shortage of critical medical goods‚Äù such as personal protective equipment and ventilators.
‚ÄúWe led a call here, the first in this country, of converting manufacturing from auto parts to PPE and ventilators. And we were successful in mobilizing what I think is the greatest peacetime mobilization of Canadian manufacturing history.‚Äù
Volpe, who is on the list of appointees to the order, describes it as his most fulfilling project.
‚ÄúWe didn‚Äôt do it for money. It certainly was a terrible time financially for everybody,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúBut when everybody was afraid, this industry stepped up and I‚Äôm proud to have ‚Äì I want to say this humbly ‚Äì I‚Äôm proud to have led that.‚Äù
Lino Saputo, another business personality being recognized by the Governor General, followed in his father‚Äôs footsteps to take the reins of his family‚Äôs eponymous cheese and dairy products company.
When Saputo was founded in Montreal in 1954, its products were delivered via bicycle. Now it‚Äôs one of the biggest dairy processors in the world.
‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not always that simple, as a third generation in a family business, to bring it to different a new level or new heights,‚Äù Saputo said.
Under his watch, the company has expanded, growing in the United States and moving into Argentina, Australia and the U.K.
‚ÄúWe‚Äôve maintained that family spirit, we‚Äôve maintained the focus on people, and that‚Äôs not always easy to do when you‚Äôre dealing with different countries and different cultures.‚Äù
Saputo is also being honoured for his philanthropy. He said he‚Äôs especially proud of a decade volunteering with United Way Centraide Canada.
Saputo said he hopes that ‚Äúthe involvement that I‚Äôve had, both in business and in the community, that I‚Äôve had the ability to change peoples‚Äô lives for the better. That‚Äôs really been my mission, my focus and hopefully that‚Äôs what I‚Äôll be remembered for.‚Äù
Appointments to the Order of Canada
Gov. Gen. Mary Simon has appointed the following people, who were recommended for appointment by the Advisory Council of the Order of Canada:
Companions
‚Äî Serge Joyal
‚Äî J. Wilton Littlechild

author: @gurufocus
title: QXO Announces Common Stock Offering | QXO Stock News
text:
- QXO Inc. (
QXO, Financial) plans a $500 million common stock offering to fund the acquisition of Beacon Roofing Supply.
- Underwriters Morgan Stanley and Goldman Sachs have the option to purchase an additional $75 million in shares.
- The offering will result in approximately 8-9% dilution of existing shareholders' stakes.
QXO Inc. (QXO) has announced a strategic move to raise $500 million through a common stock offering. This initiative includes an additional option for underwriters to purchase up to $75 million of shares at the same price. The primary goal of this capital raise is to finance a portion of the company's pending acquisition of Beacon Roofing Supply, a transaction valued at approximately $11 billion.
The offering, which is not contingent upon the completion of the acquisition, provides QXO with flexibility in capital allocation. This approach suggests that QXO's management is prepared for various scenarios, including potential regulatory challenges or alternative strategic opportunities.
Morgan Stanley and Goldman Sachs, prominent investment banks, are serving as underwriters for this offering. Their involvement is a testament to the institutional confidence in QXO's strategic direction. The transaction will be executed through multiple trading platforms, including the New York Stock Exchange and the over-the-counter market.
Current shareholders should prepare for a potential dilution of approximately 8-9% of their existing holdings as QXO is expected to issue around 35-40 million new shares, assuming the stock's market price remains steady. This dilution could initially pressure earnings per share and stock prices. However, successful integration of the Beacon acquisition could significantly enhance QXO's growth prospects.
This offering represents QXO's calculated shift towards equity financing amidst higher interest rates, aiming to maintain balance sheet flexibility. The move into the roofing supply sector may either represent vertical integration within construction materials or a strategic diversification into new markets.
topics: Economy, Business and Finance->mergers and acquisitions

author: El Mercurio S.A.P.
title: "Ajenos" al INBA, "bajada a los cuartos", "anti-sistema" y el 18-O: Las tesis sobre c√≥mo se origin√≥ la explosi√≥n
text:
La explosi√≥n al interior de un ba√±o del Internado Nacional Barros Arana (INBA) de la comuna de Santiago, que dej√≥ a 35 estudiantes heridos y cinco de ellos en riesgo vital, abri√≥ una nueva inc√≥gnita en torno a la tragedia: el origen del incidente se trat√≥ de una manifestaci√≥n o no.
De acuerdo con los antecedentes que se manejan hasta ahora, la explosi√≥n se habr√≠a registrado en uno de los ba√±os del recinto, presuntamente mientras un grupo de alumnos preparaba bombas molotov para luego lanzarlas contra Carabineros en la v√≠a p√∫blica.
La persecutora Macarena Ca√±as , de la Fiscal√≠a Metropolitana Centro Norte, detall√≥ ayer "el sitio del suceso era el interior de un ba√±o en donde se produce por los vestigios esta explosi√≥n, y hay evidencia que pude advertir respecto de distintos elementos que son habituales de la confecci√≥n de bombas molotov, pero como les digo, la informaci√≥n que nos puede brindar finalmente Labocar y Bomberos de Chile respecto de c√≥mo se inici√≥, hasta d√≥nde alcanz√≥ y otros elementos tambi√©n son importantes en definitiva".
La persecutora tambi√©n sostuvo que se est√° indagando si los elementos que provocaron la explosi√≥n fueron ingresados por los estudiantes o si ya estaban dentro del establecimiento educacional. Tambi√©n se est√° verificando si los docentes estaban al tanto de estos hechos, algunos de los cuales no habr√≠an informado a las autoridades por temor a represalias.
Comenzadas las diligencias investigativas del caso, diversas autoridades nacionales se refirieron esta jornada respecto de que si el hecho que origin√≥ la tragedia se trababa de una manifestaci√≥n o no.
Emilia Schneider (FA)
Por un lado, la diputada Emilia Schneider (FA), quien preside la comisi√≥n de Educaci√≥n de la C√°mara de Diputados, se√±al√≥ esta jornada en conversaci√≥n con CNN Radio que "con los antecedentes que tenemos, ser√≠a irresponsable de mi parte y de cualquiera atribuirle a alg√∫n sector pol√≠tico, alg√∫n sector ideol√≥gico, las manifestaciones del d√≠a de ayer".
"Las y los estudiantes salieron el d√≠a de ayer a las calles por los cinco a√±os del estallido social", sostuvo. Se√±al√≥ adem√°s que "es inaceptable el manejo de explosivos, de elementos incendiarios, dentro de los establecimientos educacionales (...), porque expone no solamente a quienes se est√°n manifestando, sino tambi√©n a estudiantes que intentan ayudar a sus compa√±eros cuando se enfrentan a una situaci√≥n como esta".
"De los estudiantes que est√°n lesionados, que se encuentran hoy d√≠a en centros de salud, no todos estaban participando de la manifestaci√≥n", complement√≥.
Ministro Nicol√°s Cataldo Esta postura discrepa con la del ministro de Educaci√≥n, Nicol√°s Cataldo . Durante el anuncio de serie de medidas tras la tragedia, el secretario de Estado conden√≥ en un punto de prensa qu e "las acciones de violencia, como las que hemos visto, no tienen ni pueden ser legitimadas como acciones de movilizaci√≥n social, porque detr√°s de esto no hay demandas, no hay objetivos, no hay rostros".
El secretario de Estado plante√≥ que "una cosa es la movilizaci√≥n social leg√≠tima, en cualquier Estado de derecho, pero no podemos legitimar las acciones de violencia cuando estas son sin sentido, sin prop√≥sito, sin orientaci√≥n y provocan adem√°s el da√±o que estamos evidenciando hoy por hoy".
Consultado ayer ante la posibilidad de que existan estudiantes involucrados externos al hecho que afect√≥ en el INBA, el secretario de Estado sostuvo que "ser√≠a muy lamentable evidentemente que hubiese interacci√≥n de un tercero ajeno al establecimiento educacional. Es parte de la investigaci√≥n y evidentemente esperamos que esto concluya lo antes posible".
Fue ayer que la ministra del Interior, Carolina Toh√° , sostuvo que "hay aqu√≠ una reflexi√≥n que hacer despu√©s de esto, ya que se ha hablado muchas veces de la gravedad de las bombas molotov, se ha hablado muchas veces que no es una herramienta de protesta v√°lida ni aceptable".
"Esperemos que esto que pas√≥ ahora ayude a que nunca m√°s ning√∫n joven, ning√∫n estudiante contemple como una posibilidad el uso de esta herramienta sea cual sea la protesta o la causa por la cual se quiera movilizar", acot√≥.
Rodrigo Roco
Rodrigo Roco, director de Educaci√≥n de Santiago, entreg√≥ diversas cifras en torno a la violencia escolar. "En el per√≠odo 2018-2019, entre cancelaciones de matr√≠culas y expulsiones, como las sanciones m√°s gravosas por faltas cometidas, no hay m√°s de 10 casos", dijo.
En ese sentido, sostuvo que "en el per√≠odo que va de mayo de 2022 a septiembre de 2024, tenemos m√°s de 50 casos de sanciones gravosas", agreg√≥.
Tambi√©n sostuvo que "como municipio, hemos presentado entre 2022 y a la fecha al menos 17 querellas criminales por hechos de violencia de este tipo".
Sobre el actuar, Roco dijo que "no tienen que ver con demandas ni petitorios estudiantiles. Y quienes as√≠ lo han planteado, lo que han hecho finalmente es confundir a la opini√≥n p√∫blica. Estos hechos de violencia no tienen un prop√≥sito. Son simplemente expresiones juveniles, expresiones de mirada anti-sistema".
Comunidad educativa
Baranny Figueroa , represente del Centro de Padre INBA, se√±al√≥ que "estamos muy coaccionados dentro del colegio como comunidad y siempre tratamos de actuar en bloque. Entonces la contenci√≥n es generalizada hacia los padres y madres que est√°n pasando por toda esta situaci√≥n que es grav√≠sima".
El Presidente del Centro de Exalumnos y Exestudiantes INBA, Harold Alarc√≥n , indic√≥ que "tal cual como en otros colegios ponen detectores de metales y tampoco existen detectores de bencina".
"Si t√∫ ves a un estudiante con una mochila que se sospecha de algo, tienes que citarlo a la rector√≠a, pedir que venga el apoderado y el apoderado le abre la mochila. No puedes abrir la mochila. Y as√≠ ocurren muchas cosas", agreg√≥.
Alarc√≥n explic√≥ a La Tercera que la situaci√≥n se dio durante la "bajada a los cuartos", que se trata de una tradici√≥n estudiantil en la que los alumnos mayores molestan a los m√°s peque√±os. Esto se dar√≠a generalmente durante el aniversario del colegio.

author: VNExplorer
title: Kansas City Chiefs defeat Miami Dolphins in 4th coldest game in NFL history
text:
Brutally cold conditions in Kansas City did not stop the Chiefs as they defeated the Miami Dolphins 26-7 at Arrowhead Stadium on Saturday.
The temperature at kickoff was -4 degrees Fahrenheit with a wind chill of -20 degrees, making it the fourth coldest game in National Football League history, according to the Peacock broadcast.
The Kansas City offense hit the ground running, marching down the field on the opening drive and capping it off with an 11-yard touchdown throw from quarterback Patrick Mahomes to wide receiver Rashee Rice. Rice would go on to finish the game with eight receptions for 130 yards.
The Chiefs never looked back, shutting down the Dolphins offense completely.
Chiefs‚Äô kicker Harrison Butker went 4 for 4 on field goals and running back Isiah Pacheco ran it in for a three-yard rushing touchdown to put the game on ice (literally) in the fourth quarter.
Mahomes finished the game with 262 yards and a touchdown.
Taylor Swift was in attendance and braved the frigid temperatures wearing a #87 Kelce jacket in support of her beau Travis Kelce. Kelce finished the game with seven receptions for 71 yards.
Patrick Mahomes (15) and Isiah Pacheco (10) of the Kansas City Chiefs line up in the backfield during the second half against the Miami Dolphins on Saturday. ‚Äì David Eulitt/Getty Images
At the end of the game, the temperature was -9 degrees and felt like -28 degrees, according to the broadcast.
Mahomes downplayed the cold weather, saying ‚ÄúIt is what it is‚Äù when asked about it on the Peacock broadcast after the game.
‚ÄúWe‚Äôre in Kansas City, at Arrowhead,‚Äù Mahomes said. ‚ÄúWe are going to play in some games like this. So, our mentality was to come out here, play football and see what happens.‚Äù
Still, Saturday‚Äôs conditions are rivaled by the coldest NFL game on record: the December 1967 ‚ÄúIce Bowl‚Äù in Wisconsin, when the Green Bay Packers beat the Dallas Cowboys amid -13 air temperature and a -48 wind chill, according to the NFL.
Earlier on Saturday, the Houston Texans defeated the Cleveland Browns 45-14.
It was a historic day for rookie Texans quarterback CJ Stroud, who threw for 274 yards and three touchdowns. Stroud‚Äôs three touchdown passes tied a rookie record in a playoff game. The 23-year-old former second-overall pick also became the youngest quarterback to win a playoff game in NFL history.
The NFL playoffs continue on Sunday with the Green Bay Packers heading to Texas to take on the Dallas Cowboys. Matthew Stafford will also make his grand return to the city where he started his NFL career when the Los Angeles Rams take on the Detroit Lions.
On Monday, the Pittsburgh Steelers head to a snowy Orchard Park, New York, to take on the Buffalo Bills and the Tampa Bay Buccaneers host the Philadelphia Eagles.
For more CNN news and newsletters create an account at CNN.com

author: @armradio
title: Peace between Armenia and Azerbaijan to benefit entire region ‚Äì FM Mirzoyan ‚Äì Public Radio of Armenia
text: Armenia is engaged in negotiations with Azerbaijan in good faith and we are more than interested in establishing lasting peace in our region, Armenian Foreign Minister Ararat Mirzoyan said at a joint press conference with Gordan Grliƒá-Radman. ‚ÄúWe believe that this will be beneficial not only for the people of Armenia, but for the countries in the region. However, we see that our constructiveness sometimes does not meet the same constructive approach in the behavior of our neighbors,‚Äù the Minister said. ‚ÄúWe have been engaged in negotiations by facilitation of the European Union, among other facilitators, and nowadays we see that Azerbaijan, unfortunately, refuses to resume the negotiations in the existing frameworks. However, we are interested in continuing our negotiations. We attach importance not so much to the issue of who facilitates the negotiations, but to the principles, according to which the negotiations should continue. And in this context I would like to emphasize again that those are territorial integrity, recognition of legitimate borders, inviolability of borders, respect for each other‚Äôs sovereignty. These are the principles, according to which, I believe, peace should be agreed,‚Äù he added.

author: @nzherald
title: Live weather: Flooding, thunderstorm risk, Auckland, Northland, Coromandel under heavy rain watch - NZ Herald
text:
A swathe of weather watches and warnings in place tonight for north and west of New Zealand Music festival, sports cancelled as thunderstorms forecast Campers, hikers and drivers warned of flooded rivers and slips Brief respite on Saturday before weather packs in again for New Year‚Äôs Eve Almost a full day of rain is likely for parts of New Zealand today and tonight, with the upper North Island and the west of the South Island in for heavy rain through to tomorrow.
Hikers, campers and New Year‚Äôs Eve revellers are being warned to take care as thunderstorms, slips and flooding - including flooded rivers - are possible in the worst-hit areas.
A warm, moist northwesterly flow is bringing rain or showers to all parts of the country, with thunderstorms possible in northern and western parts of both islands and the Deep South.
Flood risk north of Auckland This afternoon MetService added heavy rain watches for Northland, Coromandel and Auckland , where rain has already been bucketing down since lunchtime. Those regions are now set for periods of heavy rain with possible thunderstorms.
Advertisement Advertise with NZME. Rain levels could approach or even exceed warning criteria in localised areas, the forecaster warned. Downpours of 25-40mm per hour were possible.
Thunderstorms and ‚Äúvery heavy, slow moving rain‚Äù meant there was a risk of pockets of flooding around the Northland-Auckland boundary this afternoon, according to forecaster Weatherwatch.co.nz .
A music festival in northwest Auckland has been cancelled at the last minute as thunder and lightning approach. The Love Your Ways festival in Kume≈´, featuring Basement Jaxx, was deemed ‚Äúunsafe to proceed‚Äù by the venue. All ticketholders would be refunded, the organisers said.
Numerous sports matches around the country have also been cancelled including across Taranaki which has been hammered by torrential rain today.
Advertisement Advertise with NZME. Weather warnings, watches covering north and west of country MetService last night put weather watches and warnings in place from Waikato and Bay of Plenty down to Fiordland, with 100-160mm of rain possible in some warning areas.
The west of the South Island is bearing the brunt of the bad weather , along with Taranaki, which has been hit by torrential rain since this morning.
A heavy rain warning is in place for Taranaki Maunga through till 3am with a peak of 15-25 mm/h expected until mid-afternoon today.
The Westland ranges are under a 21-hour heavy rain warning until 6am Saturday, with 100-140 mm of rain expected over that time and peak rates of 20-30mm/h. Nelson has a heavy rain warning until 7pm tonight with up to 90mm of rain in total.
üåßÔ∏èüü† Severe Weather Warnings
Heavy rain continues to feed into the west of New Zealand today, along with the risk of thunderstorms.
Heavy rain warnings for the ranges of Westland, areas west of Motueka and Taranaki Maunga. pic.twitter.com/4ZvhdwEOkc
‚Äî MetService (@MetService) December 28, 2023 Heavy rain watches lasting 22 hours are in place for Buller, Waikato, Waitomo, Taumarunui, Taup≈ç, Tongariro National Park and the Kaimanawa Mountains, while Fiordland‚Äôs watch lasts for 20 hours.
In the Bay of Plenty including Rotorua a heavy rain watch is in place till 10am Saturday.
Rainfall amounts could reach warning criteria in all those areas, with thunderstorms also possible in many areas.
Heavy rain means streams and rivers can rise rapidly and driving conditions may be hazardous, with possible surface flooding and slips. Thunderstorms are also possible in many areas, bringing intense localised downpours, according to MetService.
The national forecaster‚Äôs meteorologist John Law said those thinking of going camping should keep an eye on the forecasts to avoid being stranded by sudden floods or slips.
With heavy rain also expected across the Tararua Ranges and the Tongariro Crossing, keen hikers should also take care, Law said.
Advertisement Advertise with NZME. New Year‚Äôs Day to bring drier weather for 2024 The fast-moving weather system should improve by mid-Saturday but another front will bring more rain on Sunday, MetService says.
But there‚Äôs good news as 2024 dawns - both MetService and private forecaster WeatherWatch expect the weather to clear for New Year‚Äôs Day.
WeatherWatch head forecaster Philip Duncan said a big block of high pressure coming in from the Tasman Sea and Southern Ocean will bring clearing, cooler weather on January 1, with the recent high humidity taking a break.

title: Detienen a una segunda persona por la muerte de un joven en A Coru√±a | Andaluc√≠a Informaci√≥n. Todas las noticias de Huelva
text: Una segunda persona, de la que no han trascendido detalles, ha sido detenida por el apu√±alamiento mortal de un joven en A Coru√±a el pasado 24 de diciembre, han informado a EFE fuentes de la Delegaci√≥n del Gobierno en Galicia. Esta segunda detenci√≥n se une a la efectuada la pasada madrugada, cuando agentes de la Polic√≠a Nacional detuvieron a un joven coru√±√©s de 21 a√±os por su presunta relaci√≥n con este caso. La madrugada del d√≠a de Nochebuena un joven de 22 a√±os falleci√≥ por herida de arma blanca en el t√≥rax tras una pelea en el cruce de las calles Juan Fl√≥rez y Sinf√≥nica de Galicia. La Delegaci√≥n del Gobierno en Galicia indica que se est√° trabajando en la identificaci√≥n de otras personas implicadas en la pelea. Las investigaciones son secretas y de ellas se ocupa la Unidad de Delincuencia Organizada y Violenta (UDEV) de la Polic√≠a Nacional, que se encarg√≥ de investigar el crimen de Samuel Luiz, que recibi√≥ una paliza mortal en A Coru√±a el 3 de julio de 2021.
